column1: #Text=is the study of prehistoric life on Earth , especially through fossils , and is an important tool for studying organisms ' evolution .
#Text=A traveller can find museums , as well as dig sites , which tell the story of our planet before mankind .
#Text=For the history of Homo Sapiens during the last 50,000 years , see Historical travel .
#Text=Too many museums to mention have paleontological exhibitions .
#Text=Here is a selection of museums with collections beyond the usual .
#Text=( 国立科学博物館 Kokuritsu kagaku hakubutsukan ) , Tokyo/Ueno , Japan .
#Text=Tue - Sun ( plus Monday public holidays ) 10AM-5PM , fall/winter ( Labour Day weekend to mid-May ) .
#Text=Daily 9AM-9PM , spring/summer ( week before Victoria Day to week before Labour Day ) .
#Text=A spectacular range of exhibits and activities showing off the rich fossils of the Alberta badlands , from dinosaurs to pollen .
#Text=Hundreds of thousands of visitors per year .

#Text=There are a variety of moderate hikes to fossil artifacts , starting from the museum during the summer Adults $ 10 , seniors ( 65 and up ) $ 8 , youth $ 6 , children 6 years and under free ; family of two adults and up to 6 children age 7 to 17 $ 30 ; two-day tickets available for 1.5 times the single-day price .

#Text=A museum dedicated to the Neanderthal Man , Homo Neanderthalensis , which populated much of Europe and the Middle East until it was displaced by Homo Sapiens , and went extinct around 40,000 BC .
#Text=Palaeontology is one of five major sections of this famous museum , and is home to thousands of extinct specimens , large and small .
#Text=Unlike most other museums of its size and genre , this one is completely free to enter .
#Text=In some places you can actually " fossil hunt " yourself , but this may be subject to a number of local regulations , as well as import/export restrictions when crossing borders .

#Text=In some cases what you find in terms of " fossils " is so commonplace that no protection need to be enforced , but it is a great way to spend a day with children ( especially the " dinosaur crowd " ) as well as to introduce amateur paleontologists to the subject .
#Text=Some museums that sit in appropriate geological contexts even offer fossil hunting as a part of their program and you should certainly take advantage of that if possible .
#Text=One of the eras that is rather " packed " with common - though pretty - fossils is limestone from the Jurassic era as it can be found in Franconian Switzerland and the English Jurassic Coast .

#Text=If you want to look for rare or valuable fossils , you would most likely have to connect with a university or science-institute who do more sophisticated digs and actually find fossils that have n't been found or at least not been scientifically described before .
#Text=In many cases those digs are only open to people with legitimate science degrees in the appropriate field(s) or studying towards one .
#Text=In case you need to cross borders for such , a tourist visa may sometimes not be the category to apply for in those cases .
